DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to validate Near-Infrared (NIRS) monitoring in patients undergoing circulatory arrest. This study will compare two-wavelength NIRS INVOS System, Somanetics; Troy, MI) with four-wavelength NIRS (Nonin Medical, Inc; Plymouth, MN) to determine which modality best correlates with jugular venous oxygen saturation
DOC.criteria: 1. Provide written informed consent from patient or legally authorized representative before surgery 2. Adult patients 1865 years of age 3. Patients will be excluded from this study if they are age less than 18 2. Are undergoing an emergent procedure 3. Have a history of insulindependent diabetes mellitus 4. Have a history of stroke 5. Are undergoing a redo sternotomy during which major bleeding occurs necessitating transfusion of > 4 units of packed red blood cells prior to the institution of circulatory arrest 6. Patients in whom a left jugular venous bulb cannula cannot successfully be placed
